article_title: Kevin Spacey: Trump is my 'House of Cards' confidant
article_text:
Kevin Spacey joked this week that when his "House of Cards" character breaks the fourth wall to look at the camera, he's speaking directly to Donald Trump Donald TrumpTrump: I can put 15 states in play in November Clinton: I'm ready for Trump's 'fantasy' campaign Trump sticks by 'Pocahontas' nickname after being challenged MORE.

"Who do you think you're talking to when you talk right to the camera?" host Stephen Colbert asked Spacey Wednesday night on CBS's "The Late Show."

ADVERTISEMENT

"This is the truth from the very beginning," Spacey responded, looking directly at the camera and dropping into character Frank Underwood's Southern drawl.

"When I'm looking directly into that camera, I'm talking to one person and one person only — and that is Donald Trump," Spacey said.

"Now it all starts to make sense," Spacey added to Colbert.

The star of the Netflix political drama, which first aired in 2013, made the remarks on the same night Trump appeared alongside 10 other candidates for the second GOP presidential debate.
